Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Loshar push perf" (#8371) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Background

Previously, the functional tests on PROD failed repeatedly:

* https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=77508&view=results
* https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=77522&view=results
* https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=77526&view=results

The functional tests push many packages in parallel, which caused an expensive SQL query to time out.

## Fix

This improves the push package API performance by avoiding a costly SQL query.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8368

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use Serilog in Gallery" (#3067) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1.       Serilog traces turn into Custom events in AI.
2.      Serilog properties turn into Custom Data properties in AI. 
3.      AI contains a filtering option, that allows to filter telemetry according to properties 
4.      Here are some tips how to write log messages, so we can take advantage of AI features, without explicitly taking dependency on AI in our business logic:

a.      Use the same Serilog properties throughout you code, so we can filter by them later

b.      For jobs, we can add a property for each job that will contain its name, and propagate in all the events, like so: https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-aspnetcore/wiki/Configure#track-custom-traceeventmetric
This will allow us to easily filter traces of a specific job, when all jobs traces are sent to the same AI app.

c. we should maybe build a glossary of terms we can reuse in log traces across our services, so we can search/filter on the same property names everywhere (e.g. avoid mixing Package, PackageId, Id, ‚Ä¶ and instead consolidate to use PackageId everywhere). This could reduce the long list of properties and make our queries more consistent (Consider a common set of strings in a common library instead of a 'documented glossary')

d. Some of these properties (such as MachineName, Version) are added automatically by one of the Enrichers (just check the code base for *Enricher class names ÔÅä).
Data that is readily available can always be added using an Enricher too, so we don‚Äôt have to pass it along in every trace call ourselves. We just need to consider if it needs to be part of the message template or not.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I18n (Internationalization and Localization) of NuGet Gallery." (#2341) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I would like to be able to run a local copy of the NuGet Gallery in my org we are however a bilingual workplace and as such would have to provide a bilingual gallery, currently all the text is hard-coded in the views. A move should be made to make the text configurable. 

For user generated packages uni-lingual is fine though localization would be a nice to have feature there as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WSOD on package upload when language identifier in package metadata fails validation." (#1807) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
To repro:

1.Create a package using NPE.
2.Change its extension to zip and expand the package file
3.Edit the metadata to change the language field to an arbitrary string of more than 20 characters.
4.Zip the package with the new metadata and change the extension back to .nupkg
5.Attempt to upload the file through the gallery.

RESULT: You'll receive a WSOD.  Investigation of logged errors reveals that this is an unhandled EntityException.  See https://qa.nugettest.org/Admin/Errors.axd/detail?id=8968 for a full stack trace.
EXPECTED: Like for other kinds of package validation that we've added in Iteration 6, this ought to generate a validation error when the user this to upload the package.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mixed versions of release and prerelease are misordered" (#1493) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
http://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='EntityFramework'&$orderby=Version

The order is ascending but 4.3.0 should be after 4.3.0-beta1 (since release versions are always greater than prerelease).

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add vulnerability messaging to package details page" (#8358) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Completes: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7650

Here we change the view to include a vulnerabilities panel for an affected package version.

Non-owner view, not expanded:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102730979-41949c80-4382-11eb-809e-7bea5218892e.png)

Owner view, expanded:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102730999-4d805e80-4382-11eb-8b5b-f5a09f86f3cc.png)

- bangs and tooltips in the version list (combined for deprecations and vulnerabilities). Again, formats and icons may be tweaked going forward. 

Vulnerability only:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102547237-a4790000-4104-11eb-9ec6-bfbbf3a801a8.png)

Vulnerability + deprecation:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102547326-c4102880-4104-11eb-8bc4-85e2c16eea40.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error NU1004 disappears when building solution after enabling ‚ÄúRestoreLockedMode‚Äù" (#8973) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet Version: Dev\5.5.0.6330
VS Version: Master\29623.15
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5

## Installation steps: 
* https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3341765&view=results

## Repro steps: 
1. Create above corresponding projects via VS. 
2. Install a few ‚ÄòPackageReference‚Äô packages into the projects.
3. Set MSBuild property ‚ÄúRestorePackagesWithLockFile‚Äù to true in csproj file.
  `<RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile>`
4. Do a restore.
5. Check it should have generated ‚Äòpackages.lock.json‚Äô file alongside *.csproj file.
6. Set msbuild property ‚ÄúRestoreLockedMode‚Äù to ‚Äútrue‚Äù.
    `<RestoreLockedMode>true</RestoreLockedMode>`
7. Install another package.
8. It should still work fine and update ‚Äòpackages.lock.json‚Äô file.
9. Manually add a new PackageReference item into csproj file.
```
<PackageReference Include="NUnit">
   <Version>3.12.0</Version>
 </PackageReference>
```
10. Perform restore.
11. Restore should fail with error ‚ÄúNU1004‚Äù
12. Build the solution.

## Expected:
The error was still showed on error list.

## Actual:
The error disappear on error list.

## Here is the record video for the repro steps:
![restore](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632775/71407713-ccab5b80-2676-11ea-9195-da8a996d5488.gif)

## Notes: 
1. The issue repro on .NET Core project.
2. The issue repro on Master\29623.15 + NuGet Client Dev\5.5.0.6355.
3. The issue is not stable, the repro rate is almost 95% for us.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Reduce the verbosity of the issue template" (#10444) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The current issue template is pretty verbose, contains information that we do not need/doesn't deviate usually and often time it leads to people deleting it altogether. 

These changes are meant to reduce the visual strain one has when looking at a new issue and improve issue quality by having something customers would be willing to follow instead of delete.

Note that this is a template tailored towards bugs. We could use a feature template, but that's something we don't have now, so I'm not yet introducing it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Opening version combobox from a package with lots of versions is super slow" (#10443) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Search for 'test10k' from package source https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3-index/index.json
Select Select the most recent version
Once the metadata is updated select a different version and wait for the metadata
Once the metadata is updated, open the combobox again

Observed: VS hangs, I had to kill VS after a couple minutes as it didn't appear to be coming back.
Observed: The time to open the combobox in general when it is working is also **very** slow anyways

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Uninstalled NuGet packages remain in the Visual Studio solution explorer" (#10442) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Product: Visual Studio

NuGet version: 5.9.0.7005

VS version: 16.9.0 preview 3 (30907.6 main)

Worked before? Yes

Works fine in Visual Studio 16.9.0 preview 2 with NuGet 5.9.0.6967.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Install a package to a project through any means (PMC or UI)
2. Uninstall a package to a project through any means (PMC or UI)
3. Check dependencies folder for project in the solution explorer and notice that uninstalled packages haven't been removed even though they have been successfully removed from the project and assets file.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15097183/104070881-e9f58e00-51d5-11eb-83cb-1ad7c762975a.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet issue template is too verbose." (#10441) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Note that I have removed the issue template. 

This template is too verbose and honestly asks for a lot of information that's not very relevant.

Note that on 1080p screens, our template requires scrolling!!
That's excessive!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "verified checkmark doesn't show on package recommendations" (#10440) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Codespaces:  fix telemetry from https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3786" (#10439) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3786 added some telemetry to help understand the root cause of https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10336.  However, there are 2 bugs:

*  The JSON schema allows dictionary entries to overwrite one another.
*  The project ID isn't hashed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Determine what downloading a specific version of a nuget package" (#10434) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi Guys, hopefully its ok to ask this question here. Don't know what else to do since I asked on stackoverflow and all I got was crickets. We are using Whitesource to scan for vulnerable dependencies. Here is one of the vulnerable packages Whitesource reported:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1213549/103939045-c4428900-50f0-11eb-89e3-98552cc9ed3b.png)


As you can see in the image if the issue in the NuGet package cache folder (actually all the issues it found were in the NuGet package cache foler):
/root/.nuget/packages/system.net.http/4.3.3/system.net.http.4.3.3.nupkg

We are not directly referencing `systme.net.http` so it must be a sub dependency of something. I have verified the issue on my machine. I can delete my nuget cache folder and and soon as I do a `dotnet restore`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1213549/103938869-880f2880-50f0-11eb-8058-dd4cb343ff9b.png)

**So the issue is how to determine what higher level dependency is causing that causing that dependency to be downloaded**  so I can upgrade that package to fix the issue? This is the only thing I could think of to try so far which apparently doesn't work:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1213549/103939379-4df25680-50f1-11eb-9689-2166fc9fbe43.png)

Most of the packages are listed as `4.3.0` which is never downloaded. I found the project in our large solution that is causing it to be downloaded by doing a `dotnet restore` project by project but still haven't been able to find the dependency. Any help would be MUCH appreciated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Codespaces:  fix telemetry from https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3786" (#10439) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3786 added some telemetry to help understand the root cause of https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10336.  However, there are 2 bugs:

*  The JSON schema allows dictionary entries to overwrite one another.
*  The project ID isn't hashed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Wrong TFM for PackageReference in Android Class Library" (#10428) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: VS UI
NuGet version: 5.8.0
VS version: VisualStudio.16.Release/16.8.3+30804.86
OS version: Windows 8.1 x64

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create **Android Class Library** in MSVS for Windows

2. Add a Nuget PackageReference that has several TFMs. In my case it is MvvmCross 7.1.2 that have TFMs:
.NETCoreApp 3.1
.NETFramework 4.6.1
.NETStandard 2.0
MonoAndroid 10.0
Tizen 4.0
UAP 10.0.16299
Xamarin.iOS 1.0
Xamarin.Mac 2.0
Xamarin.TVOS 1.0
Xamarin.WatchOS 1.0

3. Use any type that is Android specific (ex. MvxAndroidViewPresenter)
4. Your lib will not compile, type is missing. The reason probably is that _netstandard2.0_ TFM is used instead of _monoandroid10.0_


### Sample Project
https://github.com/Paul-N/AndroidClassLibDemo

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
